intro: Antholyza meriana var. minor, commonly known as the lesser antholyza, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in specialty gardens.
